title: Footballer saves opponents life by pulling his tongue out of his throat following collision | Metro News
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 6:29 am Kone saved Berkovec’s life (Picture: isport.cz) 
A footballer has been hailed a hero after his quick actions saved the life of his opposition’s goalkeeper. 
Martin Berkovec crashed into his own defender, Daniel Krch, after leaving the penalty box to collect a ball. 
Berkovec then fell to the floor after going limp while playing for Bohemians 1905 against Slovacko in the Czech Republic. 
Francis Kone immeditately noticed that something was wrong so went over to help. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
He removed Berkovec’s tongue from his throat to prevent him swallowing it. 
It’s Pokemon Day! Plus there could be a massive new Pokemon Go update 
Berkovec later wrote on Facebook after recovering: ‘I would like to thank Francis Kone for rescue and emergency at today’s game… I’m glad for the relief and thanks again!!!’. 
Kone said that he has actually been in the same situation four times and had saved four people’s lives by pulling their tongue to save them from suffocating.
